chrome.browserAction

Top-Level Variables
browserAction: ChromeBrowserAction
Classes
ChromeBrowserAction

Use browser actions to put icons in the main Google Chrome toolbar, to the right of the address bar. In addition to its icon(#icon), a browser action can also have a tooltip(#tooltip), a badge(#badge), and a <a href = '#popups'>popup</a>.

Top-Level Variables

static final ChromeBrowserAction browserAction

Accessor for the chrome.browserAction namespace.

Class ChromeBrowserAction

Fields
onClicked: Stream
Getters and Setters
onClicked: Stream<dynamic>
Methods
disable(int tabId): void
enable(int tabId): void
getBadgeBackgroundColor(dynamic details): Future<dynamic>

setBadgeText(dynamic details): void

setTitle(dynamic details): void

Fields

final Stream onClicked

Getters and Setters

Stream<dynamic> get onClicked

Fired when a browser action icon is clicked. This event will not fire if the browser action has a popup.

Methods

void disable(int tabId)

Disables the browser action for a tab.

tabId The id of the tab for which you want to modify the browser action.

void enable(int tabId)

Enables the browser action for a tab. By default, browser actions are enabled.

tabId The id of the tab for which you want to modify the browser action.

Future<dynamic> getBadgeBackgroundColor(dynamic details)

Gets the background color of the browser action.

Future<String> getBadgeText(dynamic details)

Gets the badge text of the browser action. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific badge text is returned.

Future<String> getPopup(dynamic details)

Gets the html document set as the popup for this browser action.

Future<String> getTitle(dynamic details)

Gets the title of the browser action.

void setBadgeBackgroundColor(dynamic details)

Sets the background color for the badge.

void setBadgeText(dynamic details)

Sets the badge text for the browser action. The badge is displayed on top of the icon.

Future<dynamic> setIcon(dynamic details)

Sets the icon for the browser action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the <b>path</b> or the <b>imageData</b> property must be specified.

void setPopup(dynamic details)

Sets the html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the browser action's icon.

void setTitle(dynamic details)

Sets the title of the browser action. This shows up in the tooltip.
